item.title: Comment on How much does hard work matter? by Engineer
item.description:
Hours matter, but working with what one might call purpose or intent matters as well. It's not just IQ or innate ability, but some combination of factors - engagement with the job, willingness to accept responsibility, good judgment, craftsmanship, etc. They are intentionally trying to improve their production function. These people's hours are generally worth more than their peers, and they will be worth even more next year.

Admittedly, some jobs lend themselves to this more than others.

And that's much harder to measure than just hours worked.
